apps.googleAccountRequired: Some apps are unavailable. To enable them, connect your SEPAL account to your Google account.

loading.error: Failed to load apps. Please reload page to try again.

asset.failedToLoadSome: Failed to load some EE assets
asset.unauthorized: You don't have access to this asset

community.label: Awesome GEE Community Datasets ({matchingResults} matches)
community.tooltip: The awesome-gee-community-datasets are community-sourced geospatial datasets made available for use by the larger Google Earth Engine community and shared publicly as Earth Engine assets.

gee.label: GEE Catalog ({matchingResults} matches)
gee.tooltip: Earth Engine's public data archive includes more than forty years of historical imagery and scientific datasets, updated and expanded daily.

datasets.failedToLoad: Failed to load Awesome GEE Community Datasets

bands.ndvi: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index: (nir - red) / (nir + red)
bands.ndmi: Normalized Difference Moisture Index: (nir - swir1) / (nir + swir1)
bands.ndwi: Normalized Difference Water Index: (green - nir) / (green + nir)
bands.mndwi: Modified Normalized Difference Water Index: (green - swir1) / (green + swir1)
bands.evi: Enhanced Vegetation Index: 2.5 * (nir - red) / (nir + 6 * red - 7.5 * blue + 1)
bands.mvi: Mangrove Vegetation Index: 0.1 * (nir - green) / abs(swir1 - green)
bands.ndbi: Normalized Difference Built-up Index: (swir1 - nir) / (swir1 + nir)
bands.nbi: New Built-up Index: red * swir1 / nir
bands.ebbi: Enhanced Built-Up and Bareness Index: (swir1 - nir) / (10 * sqrt(swir1 + thermal))
bands.bui: Built-Up Index: (red - swir1) / (red + swir1) + (swir2 - swir1) / (swir2 + swir1)

body.starting-sepal-failed: Something has gone wrong. Please reload the page and try again.

dotFiles.label: dotfiles
dotFiles.hide.tooltip: Hide files beginning with a dot
dotFiles.show.tooltip: Show files beginning with a dot

browse.removeConfirmation: Remove {directories} {directories, plural, one {directory} other {directories}} and {files} {files, plural, one {file} other {files}}?
browse.selected: {directories} {directories, plural, one {directory} other {directories}} and {files} {files, plural, one {file} other {files}} selected

eeTable.unauthorized: You don't have access to this EE Table

fusionTable.unauthorized: You don't have access to this Fusion Table

error.wrongType: Asset is of type {actualType} while the only allowed types are: {allowedTypes}.

error.noTrainingData: There is no training data in selected area of interest.

home.connectivityError: You are currently unable to connect to the SEPAL server.

sections.help: Open SEPAL documentation in a new tab/window

apps.description: Extend the features in SEPAL with custom data processing applications
apps.title: Extensible with apps

process.description: Fast and easy processing of geo data
process.title: Process geo data

terminal.description: Powerful command-line tools for data processing
terminal.title: Terminal

forgot-password.instructions: Provide us with the email address of your SEPAL account and we'll send you an email with instructions on how to reset your password.
forgot-password.label: Forgot your password ?
forgot-password.success: An email with password reset instructions has been sent to {email}.

about.description: SEPAL is an opensource project by the Open Foris team in Forestry Department of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), funded by the Government of Norway.
about.title: About

computingPower.description: Harness high performance cloud-based computing and modern geospatial data infrastructures.
computingPower.title: Computing power

easeOfUse.description: Allows users to query and process satellite data quickly and efficiently, tailor their products for local needs, and produce sophisticated and relevant geospatial analyses quickly.
easeOfUse.title: Ease of use

googleEarthEngine.description: Get access to Google Earth Engine's multi-petabyte catalog of satellite imagery and use their planetary-scale analysis capabilities. All without writing a single line of code. Just connect your Google account to SEPAL.
googleEarthEngine.title: Earth Engine

integrations.description: SEPAL doesn't want to reinvent the wheel. We rather use and integrate with existing solutions, such as Open Foris Collect Earth Online, for visual interpretation of satellite imagery.
integrations.title: Integrations

jupyterNotebook.description: Run any of the geospatial processing notebooks in SEPAL's catalogue, or develop your own. The hosted Jupyter server comes with Python 3, R, and JavaScript kernels.
jupyterNotebook.title: Jupyter Notebook

powerUsers.description: Get access to dedicated Linux instances, with up to 128 CPU cores, 2TB of RAM and a host of development and geospatial tools installed. Access it directly from within the browser, or through an SSH client. Transfer files to and from the instance with rsync, scp, or your favorite FTP client.
powerUsers.title: Power Users

rstudio.description: Develop your R scripts with RStudio, directly inside SEPAL. Use any of the many useful R packages already installed, and install your own when you need to.
rstudio.title: RStudio Server

shiny.description: Perform stratified area estimation, time-series analysis with BFAST, and other geospatial processing through the R Shiny apps hosted in SEPAL.
shiny.title: Shiny Server

username.label: Username
username.format: Username must start with a letter and can only contain letters and digits
username.duplicate: This username is not available, please choose another one

email.label: Email
email.format: Please enter a valid email address
email.duplicate: This email is not available, please choose another one

intendedUse.placeholder: What do you plan to do with SEPAL?

signup.success: You've successfully signed up to SEPAL. An activation email has been sent to {email}.

password.invalid: Password must be at least 8 characters long

landing.tagline: System for earth observations, data access, processing & analysis for land monitoring.
landing.title: SEPAL

rgb.label: RGB

hsv.label: HSV
hsv.tooltip: Three bands mapping to hue, saturation, and value

Labels.description: Map labels, roads and points of interest

Classification.description: Map legend. It highlights the class of the pixel under the mouse cursor.

error.connectionError: Failed to connect to server. Either your internet connection failed, or server is unavailable at the moment.
error.generic: SEPAL encountered an error. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.

form.noImagery: Please add at least one image.

ccdc.description: Create a CCDC asset from a time-series.

endDate.label: End date
endDate.tooltip: The last date of the time-series, exclusive.

startDate.label: Start date
startDate.tooltip: The first date of the time-series, inclusive.

aggressive.label: Aggressive
aggressive.tooltip: Be aggressive in detecting breaks in the time-series. It might detect breaks where there are none.

conservative.label: Conservative
conservative.tooltip: Be conservative in detecting breaks in the time-series. It might miss more subtle breaks or breaks where there is bad data availability

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.tooltip: Be moderate in detecting breaks in the time-series.

tmaskBands.label: TMask bands
tmaskBands.noneOrTwo: Exactly two bands must be selected or none

classification.label: Classification
classification.tooltip: (Optional) Select a classification recipe and apply the classifier to every acquisition in the time-series.

cloudPercentageThreshold.label: Max cloud cover %
cloudPercentageThreshold.tooltip: Filter out scenes with higher cloud cover higher than this threshold

form.required: A data source must be selected

ccdcSlice.description: Create a slice of a CCDC asset, for a specific date.

date.label: Date of slice
date.range: The CCDC segments were created with data from {segmentsStartDate} to {segmentsEndDate}

endDate.label: End date
endDate.range: The CCDC segments were created with data from {startDate} to {endDate}
endDate.tooltip: The end date of the slice

startDate.label: Start date
startDate.tooltip: The start date of the slice

breakAnalysisBand.label: Break analysis band
breakAnalysisBand.tooltip: The band to use when analyzing which breakpoint to provide data for.

ANY.label: Any
ANY.tooltip: Include all breakpoints independent on their change magnitude direction.

DECREASE.label: Decrease
DECREASE.tooltip: Only include breakpoints with a negative break magnitude in the break analysis band.

INCREASE.label: Increase
INCREASE.tooltip: Only include breakpoints with an positive break magnitude in the break analysis band.

breakMagnitudeDirection.label: Break magnitude direction
breakMagnitudeDirection.tooltip: Specify which breakpoints to filter out, based on weather the break magnitude for the break analysis band decrease or increase.

CONFIDENCE.label: Confidence
CONFIDENCE.tooltip: Select the breakpoint with the highest confidence.

FIRST.label: First
FIRST.tooltip: Select the first breakpoint in the date range.

LAST.label: Last
LAST.tooltip: Select the last breakpoint in the date range.

MAGNITUDE.label: Magnitude
MAGNITUDE.tooltip: Select the breakpoint with the highest break magnitude.

breakSelection.label: Break selection
breakSelection.tooltip: Specify which of the break points to provide data for.

closest.label: Closest
closest.tooltip: Extrapolate the segment closest to the date.

next.label: Next
next.tooltip: Back-extrapolate the segment after the date.

previous.label: Previous
previous.tooltip: Extrapolate the segment before the date.

extrapolate.label: Extrapolate
extrapolate.tooltip: Generate a new model based on the segment before or after the gap.

interpolate.label: Interpolate
interpolate.tooltip: Generate a new model based on surrounding segments. If there isn't any segment before or after, the pixel will be masked.

gapStrategy.label: Gap strategy

mask.label: Mask
mask.tooltip: Mask all pixels that fall on a gap.

gapStrategy.tooltip: Decide which strategy to use for pixels where there is no CCDC segment. There will be gaps during detected breaks or for dates before and after the CCDC date range.

harmonics.label: Harmonics
harmonics.tooltip: Specify how many harmonics from the CCDC regression model to use when creating the slice.

minBreakConfidence.label: Min break confidence
minBreakConfidence.tooltip: The minimum confidence of a breakpoint to be included. This is calculated by the break magnitude divided by the RMSE.

skipBreakInLastSegment.label: Breaks at the end
skipBreakInLastSegment.tooltip: CCDC sometimes detect breaks in the last segment. These can at times be unreliable.

options.title: CCDC slice options
options.tooltip: Configure how the CCDC slice is made

amplitude1.label: Amplitude 1
amplitude1.tooltip: The amplitude of the model's first order harmonic

amplitude2.label: Amplitude 2
amplitude2.tooltip: The amplitude of the model's second order harmonic

amplitude3.label: Amplitude 3
amplitude3.tooltip: The amplitude of the model's third order harmonic

bandTypes.atLeastOne: At least one band type must be selected

intercept.label: Intercept
intercept.tooltip: The intercept of the model's linear component

breakConfidence.label: Break confidence
breakConfidence.tooltip: Confidence of break, defined as magnitude/rmse

bandTypes.label: Band types

phase1.label: Phase 1
phase1.tooltip: The phase of the model's first order harmonic

phase2.label: Phase 2
phase2.tooltip: The phase of the model's second order harmonic

phase3.label: Phase 3
phase3.tooltip: The phase of the model's third order harmonic

slope.label: Slope
slope.tooltip: The slope of the model's linear component

value.label: Value
value.tooltip: The evaluated value of the harmonic models for the specified date

baseBands.atLeastOne: At least one base band must be selected
baseBands.label: Base bands

changeProb.label: Probability
changeProb.tooltip: Probability of detected break being accurate

segmentBands.label: Segment bands
segmentBands.tooltip: Bands with information about the segment the slice falls in. If a pixel falls in a gap, the previous segment will be used

asset.label: Earth Engine CCDC Asset
asset.title: Earth Engine CCDC Asset
asset.notCcdc: Asset does not contain CCDC segments

asset.invalid: Asset must be an exported CCDC asset

asset.required: An asset ID must be specified

source.tooltip: Select EE asset with CCDC segments to slice

preview.label: CCDC slice

changeAlerts.description: Generate change alerts using a CCDC as baseline.

latest.label: Latest
latest.tooltip: Render a composite of the latest available imagery in the period

median.label: Median
median.tooltip: Render a median composite of the period

calibration.label: Calibration
calibration.tooltip: Render a composite of the calibration period

changes.label: Changes
changes.tooltip: Render change in the monitoring period

monitoring.label: Monitoring
monitoring.tooltip: Render a composite of the monitoring period

monitoringEnd.label: Monitoring end
monitoringEnd.tooltip: The date when monitoring ends. You typically set this to today's date

form.range: The CCDC segments were created with data from {segmentsStartDate} to {segmentsEndDate}.
form.noRange: The CCDC segments doesn't specify any date range.

date.title: Date range
date.tooltip: Specify date range to get alerts for

minConfidence.label: Min confidence
minConfidence.tooltip: Minimum number of errors from reference model to consider observation a change.

numberOfObservations.label: Number of observations
numberOfObservations.tooltip: Number of observations in window when looking at consecutive changes

minNumberOfChanges.label: Min number of changes
minNumberOfChanges.tooltip: Minimum number of change observations in window to consider the window a change, or minimum number of stable observations to consider the window stable

mustBeConfirmedInMonitoring.label: Confirmed in monitoring
mustBeConfirmedInMonitoring.tooltip: A change must be confirmed in the monitoring period. If it was confirmed already in the calibration period, the change is discarded. This prevents changes occuring in the calibration period from being detected.

mustBeStableBeforeChange.label: Stable before change
mustBeStableBeforeChange.tooltip: A change must be stable before it's detected. Otherwise, the change is discarded. This prevents changes that happened outside of the monitoring period in the last year from being detected.

mustStayChanged.label: Must stay change
mustStayChanged.tooltip: A change must stay change, and not be classified as stable after the change was detected. Otherwise, the change is discarded. This lowers the risk of multiple consecutive outliers to be classified as change.

cloudPercentageThreshold.tooltip: Filter out scenes with higher cloud cover higher than this threshold

form.required: A data source must be selected

preview.description: Preview of change alerts, generated on the fly by EE.

findingNextPoint.notFound: Unable to find any points for you. Try to select some yourself.
findingNextPoint.title: Finding next point...

classification.description: Classify imagery from SEPAL or Google Earth Engine. Include imagery from multiple points in time to do change detection.

referenceData.description: Reference data points used to create classification
referenceData.label: Reference data

latitude.label: Latitude
latitude.tooltip: Include the latitude of each pixel.

water.label: Water
water.tooltip: Include JRC Global Surface Water Mapping Layers.

auxiliaryImagery.title: Auxiliary sources
auxiliaryImagery.tooltip: Include Auxiliary image sources in classification

decisionTree.label: Decision tree
decisionTree.placeholder: Paste or drop file with the decision tree...
decisionTree.tooltip: Paste or drop file with the decision tree

samplingRate.label: Sampling rate
samplingRate.tooltip: The sampling rate for stochastic tree boosting

shrinkage.label: Shrinkage
shrinkage.tooltip: The shrinkage parameter in [0, 1] controls the learning rate of procedure

cosine.label: Spectral angle
cosine.tooltip: Spectral angle from the un-normalized class mean

euclidean.label: Euclidean
euclidean.tooltip: Euclidean distance from the un-normalized class mean

mahalanobis.label: Mahalanobis
mahalanobis.tooltip: Mahalanobis distance from the class mean

lambda.label: Lambda
lambda.tooltip: A smoothing lambda. Used to avoid assigning zero probability to classes not seen during training, instead using lambda / (lambda * nFeatures)

bagFraction.label: Bag fraction
bagFraction.tooltip: The fraction of input to bag per tree

maxNodes.label: Max nodes
maxNodes.tooltip: The maximum number of leaf nodes in each tree. If unspecified, defaults to no limit

minLeafPopulation.label: Min leaf population
minLeafPopulation.tooltip: Only create nodes whose training set contains at least this many points

numberOfTrees.label: Number of trees
numberOfTrees.tooltip: The number of decision trees to create

variablesPerSplit.label: Variables per split
variablesPerSplit.tooltip: The number of variables per split. If unspecified, uses the square root of the number of variables.

coef0.label: coef₀
coef0.tooltip: The coef₀ value in the kernel function

gamma.label: Gamma
gamma.tooltip: The gamma value in the kernel function. Defaults to the reciprocal of the number of features

LINEAR.label: Linear
LINEAR.tooltip: u′×v (work well with large training data sets)

svmType.label: SVM type

ONE_CLASS.label: ONE-CLASS
ONE_CLASS.tooltip: Train on a single class, using outliers as negative examples

svmType.tooltip: The decision procedure to use for classification

ANGLE.label: Angle
ANGLE.tooltip: Include bands with the angle evaluated pair-wise between all selected bands

DIFFERENCE.label: Difference
DIFFERENCE.tooltip: Include bands with the difference evaluated pair-wise between all selected bands

DISTANCE.label: Distance
DISTANCE.tooltip: Include bands with the distance evaluated pair-wise between all selected bands

NORMALIZED_DIFFERENCE.label: Normalized difference
NORMALIZED_DIFFERENCE.tooltip: Include bands with the normalized difference evaluated pair-wise between all selected bands

RATIO.label: Ratio
RATIO.tooltip: Include bands with the ratio evaluated pair-wise between all selected bands

derivedBands.label: Derived bands

RLCMS.label: RLCMS
RLCMS.tooltip: Include bands used by the Regional Land Cover Monitoring System

SIMPLE.label: Simple
SIMPLE.tooltip: Include red, nir, swir1, swir2 and ratios between them.

derivedBands.tooltip: Add additional derived bands to use in the classification.

GEO_JSON.tooltip: Location is in a single GeoJSON column

locationType.label: Location type
locationType.tooltip: Select how location of reference data is represented

XY_COLUMNS.label: X/Y coordinate columns
XY_COLUMNS.tooltip: Location is in two X/Y coordinate columns

assetToSample.required: You must enter an asset ID

sampleScale.tooltip: The scale to sample the asset in

samplesPerClass.label: Samples per class
samplesPerClass.required: You must specify the number of samples to collect for each class
samplesPerClass.tooltip: The number of samples to extract from the image

EE_TABLE.title: EE TABLE
EE_TABLE.tooltip: Load reference data from an EE table.

RECIPE.label: Saved SEPAL recipe
RECIPE.title: SEPAL RECIPE
RECIPE.tooltip: Use training data from a saved SEPAL recipe.

preview.label: Classification

regression.description: Create a regression from SEPAL or Google Earth Engine imagery.

valueColumn.label: Value column
valueColumn.tooltip: Select column containing the values to train the regression classifier with.

sampleCount.label: Sample count
sampleCount.required: You must specify the number of samples to collect
sampleCount.tooltip: The number of samples to extract from the image

valueBand.label: Value band
valueBand.placeholder: Select band with value to sample...
valueBand.tooltip: The band to sample and use to train the regression classifier.

sampleImage.noIntersection: The image to sample does not intersect the recipe
sampleImage.unableToSampleAllPixels: Unable to sample {numPixels} from the image. It's either too few pixels or too large areas of the image is masked.

EE_TABLE.label: Earth Engine Table
EE_TABLE.tooltip: Load reference data from an EE table
EE_TABLE.title: EE Table

RECIPE.label: Saved SEPAL recipe
RECIPE.tooltip: Use training data from a saved SEPAL recipe
RECIPE.title: SEPAL Recipe

unsupervisedClassification.description: Create an unsupervised classification from SEPAL or Google Earth Engine imagery.

numberOfSamples.label: Number of samples
numberOfSamples.tooltip: The number of samples to use to train the clusterer.

sampleScale.label: Scale to sample in
sampleScale.tooltip: The scale to sample the asset in

kmeans.label: KMeans
kmeans.tooltip: Cluster data using the k-means algorithm.

cascadeKMeans.label: Cascade KMeans
cascadeKMeans.tooltip: Cascade simple k-means selects the best k according to the Calinski-Harabasz criterion.

xmeans.label: XMeans
xmeans.tooltip: X-Means is K-Means with an efficient estimation of the number of clusters.

lvq.label: LVQ
lvq.tooltip: A Clusterer that implements the Learning Vector Quantization algorithm.

numberOfClusters.label: Number of clusters
numberOfClusters.tooltip: The number of clusters to generate

minNumberOfClusters.label: Min number of clusters
minNumberOfClusters.tooltip: The minimum number of clusters to generate

maxNumberOfClusters.label: Max number of clusters
maxNumberOfClusters.tooltip: The maximum number of clusters to generate

canopies.label: Canopies
canopies.tooltip: Specify whether to use canopies to reduce the number of distance calculations or not.

maxCandidates.label: Max candidates
maxCandidates.tooltip: Maximum number of candidate canopies to retain in memory at any one time when using canopy clustering. T2 distance plus, data characteristics, will determine how many candidate canopies are formed before periodic and final pruning are performed, which might result in exceess memory consumption. This setting avoids large numbers of candidate canopies consuming memory.

periodicPruning.label: Periodic pruning
periodicPruning.tooltip: How often to prune low density canopies when using canopy clustering.

minDensity.label: Min density
minDensity.tooltip: Minimum canopy density, when using canopy clustering, below which a canopy will be pruned during periodic pruning.

t1.label: T1
t1.tooltip: The T1 distance to use when using canopy clustering. A value < 0 is taken as a positive multiplier for T2.

t2.label: T2
t2.tooltip: The T2 distance to use when using canopy clustering. Values < 0 cause a heuristic based on attribute std. deviation to be used.

preserveOrder.label: Preserve order
preserveOrder.tooltip: Specify whether order of instances should be preserved or not.

fast.label: Fast
fast.tooltip: Enables faster distance calculations, using cut-off values. Disables the calculation/output of squared errors/distances.

learningRate.label: Learning rate
learningRate.tooltip: The learning rate for the training algorithm. Value should be greater than 0 and less or equal to 1.

epochs.label: Epochs
epochs.tooltip: Number of training epochs. Value should be greater than or equal to 1.

normalizeInput.label: Normalize input
normalizeInput.tooltip: Specifies whether attributes should be normalized or not.

maxKMeans.label: Max K-means
maxKMeans.tooltip: The maximum number of iterations to perform in K-means.

maxForChildren.label: Max for children
maxForChildren.tooltip: The maximum number of iterations in KMeans that is performed on the child centers.

useKD.label: Use K-D tree
useKD.tooltip: Specifies whether a K-D tree should be used or not.

cutoffFactor.label: Cut-off factor
cutoffFactor.tooltip: Takes the given percentage of the split centroids if none of the children win.

stack.description: Create an image stack from SEPAL and/or Google Earth Engine image assets.

bandNames.title: Band names
bandNames.tooltip: Set the band names of the stack.
bandNames.invalidFormat: Must start with a letter or underscore and then be followed by only numbers, letters and underscores. Cannot be longer than 30 characters

bandMath.description: Perform band math on imagery from SEPAL and/or Google Earth Engine image assets.
bandMath.duplicateName: Duplicate name. There are other images or calculations with this name.
bandMath.invalidName: Cannot use names that are math functions or constants.

name.label: Image name
name.tooltip: The name of this image to use when referring to it within expressions.

usedBands.label: Bands
usedBands.tooltip: The bands to apply the function to

function.label: Function
function.tooltip: Reduce the selected bands to a single band value using the selected function.

bandName.label: Band name
bandName.tooltip: The name of the resulting band after applying the function.

calculationName.label: Calculation name
calculationName.tooltip: The name of this calculation to use when referring to it within expressions.

dataType.label: Data type
dataType.tooltip: The data type to cast the output band(s) to.

bandRenameStrategy.label: Band rename strategy
bandRenameStrategy.tooltip: The expression generates an image with multiple bands. Select which strategy to use for naming them.

REGEX.label: Regular expression
REGEX.tooltip: Renames the bands outputted by the calculation by applying a regular expression replacement.

regex.label: Regular expression
regex.tooltip: The regular expression used to match bands to rename. Any bands not matched by the regex will included without renaming.

PREFIX.label: Prefix
PREFIX.tooltip: Apply this prefix to all bands outputted by expression

SUFFIX.label: Suffix
SUFFIX.tooltip: Apply this suffix to all bands outputted by expression

REGEX.label: Replacement
REGEX.tooltip: The text with which to replace each match. Supports $n syntax for captured values.

outputBands.title: Output band names
outputBands.tooltip: Select bands to output and their corresponding names.
outputBands.invalidFormat: Must start with a letter or underscore and then be followed by only numbers, letters and underscores. Cannot be longer than 30 characters

addImage.label: Add
addImage.tooltip: Include bands from image or calculation to output

addBands.tooltip: Add band to include in recipe output.

classChange.description: Create a class change map from two categorical images, either SEPAL recipes or EE assets.

legend.label: Legend
legend.tooLong: The legend is too long. It cannot contain more than {max} entries.

button.label: OPT
button.tooltip: Configure how class change is created

minConfidence.label: Min confidence
minConfidence.tooltip: The minimum change in classification probability required to consider a change.

closeRecipe.message: Do you want to save this recipe?

indexChange.description: Create an index change map from two images, either SEPAL recipes or EE assets.

button.label: MAP
button.tooltip: Map index difference to change category

button.label: OPT
button.tooltip: Configure how index change is created

minConfidence.label: Min confidence
minConfidence.tooltip: Determines how large the difference must be to be considered significant. If difference/error is smaller than this value, the difference is considered 0 when creating the categorical change band.

asset.description: Create and configure an image from an EE image or image collection asset.

CUSTOM_DATE_RANGE.label: Date range
CUSTOM_DATE_RANGE.tooltip: Include images from a custom date range.

YEAR.label: Year
YEAR.tooltip: Include images from a specified calendar year.

filter.title: Collection Filter
filter.tooltip: Filter down collection to images of interest

mask.title: Mask imagery
mask.tooltip: Mask out unwanted areas of imagery

MEDIAN.label: Median
MEDIAN.tooltip: Take the median of each band for the images in the collection

MEAN.label: Mean
MEAN.tooltip: Take the mean of each band for the images in the collection

MIN.label: Min
MIN.tooltip: Use the minimum value of each band for the images in the collection

MAX.label: Max
MAX.tooltip: Use the maximum value of each band for the images in the collection

SD.label: SD
SD.tooltip: Use the standard deviation of each band for the images in the collection

MODE.label: Mode
MODE.tooltip: Use the most common value of each band for the images in the collection. This only make sense for categorical bands

composite.title: Composite
composite.tooltip: Combine images in image collection into a single image

masking.description: Apply a mask to an image.

mosaic.description: Create a mosaic using Landsat or Sentinel 2.

location.label: Map location
location.tooltip: Synchronize map location (center and zoom) with other maps or keep it independent

retile.label: Re-tile
retile.tooltip: Split Earth Engine processing of each tile into smaller sub-tiles. Please use this control sparingly, and only if really necessary, as it would cause a much higher Earth Engine resource utilization, and in most cases it would just slow down tile rendering. It should only be used when one or more tiles fail with "User memory limit exceeded" errors, possibly increasing the re-tile level one step at a time.

buffer.label: Buffer
buffer.tooltip: Area of interest and preview will take longer to show up when buffering is enabled.

assetBounds.description: Use bounds of selected EE asset.
assetBounds.title: EE asset bounds

placeholder.noEETable: Enter a EE Table ID first
Enter a EE Table ID first

placeholder.noFusionTable: Enter a Fusion Table ID first
Enter a Fusion Table ID first

polygon.description: Draw a polygon on the map.
polygon.title: Draw a polygon

clearSelectedScenes.message: You are about to clear all selected scenes.
clearSelectedScenes.title: Clear selected scenes

aggressive.label: Aggressive
aggressive.tooltip: Mask an additional 600m around each larger cloud. This helps prevent hazy pixels at the border of clouds to be included in the mosaic.

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.tooltip: Mask an additional 120m around each larger cloud. This helps prevent hazy pixels at the border of clouds to be included in the mosaic.

none.label: None
none.tooltip: Only mask the clouds. It might leave hazy pixels around masked clouds, but will minimize the amount of maxed pixels in the mosaic.

pino26.label: PINO 26
pino26.tooltip: Use Pan-Tropical S2 cloud detection algorithm developed by Dario Simonetti

aggressive.label: Aggressive
aggressive.tooltip: Rely on image source QA bands and a cloud scoring algorithm for cloud masking. This will probably mask out some built-up areas and other bright features.

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.tooltip: Rely only on image source QA bands for cloud masking

none.label: Off
none.tooltip: Use cloud-free pixels if possible, but don't mask areas without cloud-free pixels

cs.tooltip: The cs band scores QA based on a spectral distance between the observed pixel and a (theoretical) clear reference observation. It can be thought of as a more instantaneous atmospheric similarity score (i.e., how similar is this pixel to what we'd expect to see in a perfectly a clear reference).

cs_cdf.tooltip: The cs_cdf band represents the likelihood an observed pixel is clear based on an estimated cumulative distribution of scores for a given location through time. It captures an expectation of the estimated score through time (i.e., if we had all the scores for this pixel through time, how would this score rank?).

maxCloudProbability.label: Max cloud probability
maxCloudProbability.tooltip: Cloud Score+ provides likelihood of clear pixels. To harmonize the input with other cloud scoring algorithms, in SEPAL, we have inverted it to represent likelihood of cloudy pixels.

dilatedCloud.label: Dilated clouds
dilatedCloud.tooltip: Cloud dilation fills any “clear” pixels that are surrounded by clouds, reducing uncertainty concerning thin cloud or adjacent-to-cloud pixels. Dilation reduces ambiguity of a cloud-contaminated pixel at the cost of potentially high commission error; this is ideal for land use/land cover change assessments analyzing large spatiotemporal stacks of data, where cloud cover can adversely alter trending analysis.

median.label: Median
median.tooltip: Use the median of remaining pixels. Pixel value will be artificial, and metadata for mosaic will be unavailable.

medoid.label: Medoid
medoid.tooltip: Use the medoid of remaining pixels.

brdf.label: BRDF
brdf.tooltip: Correct for bidirectional reflectance distribution function (BRDF) effects.

calibrate.label: Calibrate
calibrate.tooltip: Calibrate bands to improve cross-sensor mosaic.

surfaceReflectance.label: SR
surfaceReflectance.tooltip: Use scenes atmospherically corrected surface reflectance.

brdfMultiplier.label: BRDF Multiplier
brdfMultiplier.tooltip: Multiplier to increase the amount of BRDF correction to apply. Normally, values between 3-4 works well. If the correction is overcompensating the BRDF effect, lower the multiplier, and increase it when the effect is not compensated for enough.

dayOfYearPercentile.label: Date
dayOfYearPercentile.max: Select pixels closest to target day
dayOfYearPercentile.off: Don't filter based on day of year

filters.label: Filters
filters.tooltip: Filter out pixels based on on percentile of selected properties

holes.label: Masked out pixels
holes.tooltips: Control if some pixels can be completely masked out due to cloud and/or snow masking or not.

prevent.label: Prevent
prevent.tooltip: Prevent pixels from being completely masked out due to cloud and/or snow masking. Pixels that would be completely masked out will retrain cloudy and/or snowy pixels.

allow.label: ALLOW
allow.tooltip: Allow pixels to be completely masked out if every acquisition are cloudy and/or snowy.

keep.label: Keep
keep.tooltip: Keep overlap between Sentinel 2orbits. This additional data will result in better models in the overlap.

remove.label: Remove
remove.tooltip: Removes overlap between Sentinel 2 orbits. This adds an extra step in the preprocessing. This tends to make the BRDF effect more noticable, and it might be worth while trying to apply BRDF correction in conjuction with this feature.

keep.label: Keep
keep.tooltip: Keep overlap between Sentinel 2 tiles. Areas with overlap will have twice or quadruple number of observations. All of these additional observations are all have the same value. Keeping them uses more memory than necessary and can lead to out of memory errors.

quickRemove.label: Quick remove
quickRemove.tooltip: Makes an effort to remove most of the overlap between Sentinel 2 tiles. By removing the duplicate data, the memory needed in processing is reduced.

remove.label: Remove
remove.tooltip: Removes all overlap between Sentinel 2 tiles. This adds an extra step in the preprocessing. By removing the duplicate data, the memory needed in processing is reduced. There is no significant difference in this memory reduction with this option compared to the quick remove option.

off.label: Off
off.tooltip: Don't mask snow. Note that some clouds might get misclassified as snow, and because of this, disabling snow masking might lead to cloud artifacts.

on.label: On
on.tooltip: Mask snow. This tend to leave some pixels with shadowy snow

info.none: Don't include seasons from the future
info.number: Include {futureSeasons} {futureSeasons, plural, one {season} other {seasons}} from the future

info.none: Don't include seasons from the past
info.number: Include {pastSeasons} {pastSeasons, plural, one {season} other {seasons}} from the past

season.label: Season
season.tooltip: Restrict the time of year to include imagery for.

targetDate.label: Target date
targetDate.tooltip: The date in which pixels in the mosaic should ideally come from.

targetYear.label: Year
targetYear.tooltip: The year which pixels in the mosaic should come from.

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.tooltip: Try to take images no too cloudy and not too far from the target date

cloudFree.label: Cloud free
cloudFree.tooltip: Prefer imagery as cloud-free as possible, ignoring the date

targetDate.label: Target date
targetDate.tooltip: Prefer imagery as close as possible to the target day

sceneSelection.noScenes: No scenes are available for the current combination of area of interest, dates and data sources. Please revise the settings in AOI, DAT and/or SRC.

dataSets.label: Datasets
dataSets.oneDataSet: Selected satellite family only have a single dataset.

form.required: A data source must be selected

preview.description: Preview of optical mosaic, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: Optical mosaic

sceneAreas.description: Manually select individual scenes to include in mosaic
sceneAreas.label: Scene areas

planetMosaic.description: Create a mosaic using Planet composites.

cloudThreshold.label: Cloud masking
cloudThreshold.tooltip: Planet composites already removes clouds. Setting this to a value > 0 will remove additional clouds.

histogramMatching.label: Histogram matching
histogramMatching.tooltip: Normalize images included in mosaic using Histogram matching. This will slow down processing significant, and can cause some details to be lost. Overall consistency and noise level can, however, be significantly improved with this option enabled.

shadowThreshold.label: Cloud shadow masking
shadowThreshold.tooltip: Planet composites already removes cloud shadows. Setting this to a value > 0 will remove additional cloud shadows.

asset.label: Earth Engine asset ID
asset.required: You must enter an asset ID

BASEMAPS.label: Custom basemaps
BASEMAPS.tooltip: Use image collection with Planet basemaps/level 1 composites

DAILY.label: Daily imagery
DAILY.tooltip: Use image collection with daily Planet imagery/level 2 imagery

NICFI.label: NICFI basemaps
NICFI.tooltip: Use image collection with the NICFI Planet basemaps/level 1 composites

preview.description: Preview of Planet mosaic, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: Planet mosaic

CUSTOM_TIME_SCAN.label: Date range
CUSTOM_TIME_SCAN.tooltip: Build a time-scan with data from a custom date range.

POINT_IN_TIME_MOSAIC.label: Date
POINT_IN_TIME_MOSAIC.tooltip: Build a mosaic with data coming as close to a specified date as possible.

YEARLY_TIME_SCAN.label: Year
YEARLY_TIME_SCAN.tooltip: Build a time-scan with data from a specified calendar year.

all.label: All
all.tooltip: Include values from all orbit numbers for a pixel.

dominant.label: Dominant
dominant.tooltip: Only include values from the dominant orbit number for a pixel.

adjacent.label: Adjacent
adjacent.tooltip: Include values from the dominant orbit of both ascending and descending orbits.

firstLast.label: First/Last
firstLast.tooltip: Mask the beginning of the first slice and the end of the last slice.

refinedLee.label: Refined Lee
refinedLee.tooltip: Refined Lee filtering is applied. This can be very slow, but often gives good results.

snic.label: SNIC
snic.tooltip: Simple Non-Iterative Clustering is used to filter out speckle.

retain.label: Retain
retain.tooltip: Retain original value for strong scatterers. They don't tend to include much speckle and some speckle filtering algorithms tends to blur them.

filter.label: Filter
filter.tooltip: Apply spatial speckle filter also to strong scatterers. It can cause some speckle filtering algorithms to blur them.

strongScattererValue1.label: VV threshold
strongScattererValue1.tooltip: The threshold to consider VV a strong scatterer when performing Lee-Sigma spatial speckle filtering.

strongScattererValue2.label: VH threshold
strongScattererValue2.tooltip: The threshold to consider VH a strong scatterer when performing Lee-Sigma spatial speckle filtering.

snicSize.label: Seed spacing
snicSize.tooltip: The superpixel seed location spacing, in pixels. If 'seeds' image is provided, no grid is produced.

snicCompactness.label: Compactness
snicCompactness.tooltip: Compactness factor. Larger values cause clusters to be more compact (square). Setting this to 0 disables spatial distance weighting.

none.label: None
none.tooltip: Don't apply any multitemporal speckle filter.

preview.description: Preview of radar mosaic, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: Radar mosaic

baytsAlerts.description: Generate forest change alerts using Sentinel-1 time-series and probabilistic change detection (based on the RADD processing pipeline).

latest.label: Latest
latest.tooltip: Render a composite of the latest available imagery in the period

median.label: Median
median.tooltip: Render a median composite of the period

first.label: First
first.tooltip: Render a composite of the first value in the monitoring period

last.label: Last
last.tooltip: Render a composite of the last value in the monitoring period

include.label: Include
include.tooltip: Include alerts confirmed before the monitoring period

exclude.label: Exclude
exclude.tooltip: Exclude alerts confirmed before the monitoring period

all.label: All
all.tooltip: Show all alerts independent on their confidence

low.label: Low
low.tooltip: Show alerts with low or high confidence

high.label: High
high.tooltip: Show only alerts with high confidence

monitoringEnd.label: Monitoring end
monitoringEnd.tooltip: The date when monitoring ends. You typically set this to today's date

date.title: Date range
date.tooltip: Specify date range to get alerts for

highConfidenceThreshold.label: High-conf threshold
highConfidenceThreshold.tooltip: The needed change probability for a high-confidence alert

lowConfidenceThreshold.label: Low-conf threshold
lowConfidenceThreshold.tooltip: The needed change probability for a low-confidence alert
lowConfidenceThreshold.tooLarge: Must be smaller than the high-conf threshold

minChangeProbability.label: Min change prob
minChangeProbability.tooltip: Min probability to consider an observation a potential change

minNonForestProbability.label: Min non-forest prob
minNonForestProbability.tooltip: Min probability to consider an observation to potentially be non-forest

maxDays.label: Max days
maxDays.tooltip: The max number of days before a lower confidence get unflagged

normalization.label: Normalization
normalization.tooltip: Enable or disable image normalization. When enabled, less false changes, due to seasonality, will be detected.

previousAlertsAsset.label: Previous alerts asset
previousAlertsAsset.tooltip: EE asset containing previous alerts as a starting point for the algorithm
previousAlertsAsset.missingBands: The asset is missing required bands: {missingBands}

sensitivityButton.tooltip: Determine how sensitive the algorithm should be to detect changes

sensitivity.label: Detection sensitivy
sensitivity.tooltip: Determine how sensitive the algorithm should be to detect changes. Medium detection sensitivity is 1. The bigger the number, the less sensitive to change the algorithm will be.

wetlandMaskAsset.label: Wetland Mask Asset
wetlandMaskAsset.tooltip: When a wetland mask is specified, the algorith will treat these areas slightly different

asset.label: Earth Engine Asset
asset.title: Earth Engine Asset
asset.notBayTSHistorical: Asset is not a BAYTS historical image or image collection

asset.invalid: Asset must be an exported BAYTS historical asset
asset.label: BAYTS historical asset
asset.required: An asset ID must be specified

reference.title: Source
reference.tooltip: Select BAYTS historical asset or recipe to use as reference for alerts

preview.description: Preview of change alerts, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: Change alerts

baytsHistorical.description: Create a Sentinel-1 historical layer as reference for BAYTS alerts.

firstLast.label: First/Last
firstLast.tooltip: Mask the beginning of the first slice and the end of the last slice.

refinedLee.label: Refined Lee
refinedLee.tooltip: Refined Lee filtering is applied. This can be very slow, but often gives good results.

snic.label: SNIC
snic.tooltip: Simple Non-Iterative Clustering is used to filter out speckle.

retain.label: Retain
retain.tooltip: Retain original value for strong scatterers. They don't tend to include much speckle and some speckle filtering algorithms tends to blur them.

filter.label: Filter
filter.tooltip: Apply spatial speckle filter also to strong scatterers. It can cause some speckle filtering algorithms to blur them.

strongScattererValue1.label: VV threshold
strongScattererValue1.tooltip: The threshold to consider VV a strong scatterer when performing Lee-Sigma spatial speckle filtering.

strongScattererValue2.label: VH threshold
strongScattererValue2.tooltip: The threshold to consider VH a strong scatterer when performing Lee-Sigma spatial speckle filtering.

snicSize.label: Seed spacing
snicSize.tooltip: The superpixel seed location spacing, in pixels. If 'seeds' image is provided, no grid is produced.

snicCompactness.label: Compactness
snicCompactness.tooltip: Compactness factor. Larger values cause clusters to be more compact (square). Setting this to 0 disables spatial distance weighting.

none.label: None
none.tooltip: Don't apply any multitemporal speckle filter.

preview.description: Preview of BAYTS historical layer, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: BAYTS historical

classification.label: Classification
classification.tooltip: (Optional) Select a classification recipe and apply the classifier to every acquisition in the time-series.

cloudPercentageThreshold.label: Max cloud cover %
cloudPercentageThreshold.tooltip: Filter out scenes with higher cloud cover higher than this threshold

form.required: A data source must be selected

preview.description: Preview of land surface phenology, generated on the fly by EE.
preview.label: Land surface phenology

form.name.label: Name
form.name.unique: Project name is already in use

remove.title: Remove project
remove.confirm: All recipes belonging to this project will be removed as well.

recipe.loadingError: Failed to load recipes. Please reload page to try again.

move.label: Move

remapping.description: Remap categorical and continuous image bands into new categories.

legend.title: Legend
legend.tooltip: Setup legend to remap imagery to

button.label: MAP
button.tooltip: Map input imagery to legend entries

assetId.label: Asset ID
assetId.tooltip: The Asset ID your image should be exported to.

Image.label: Image
Image.tooltip: Export recipe as a single image asset.

ImageCollection.label: Image collection
ImageCollection.tooltip: Export recipe tiled into an image collection. This is good for larger exports as it gives you feedback on the progress, and will allow you to resume failed or canceled export tasks.

bands.atLeastOne: At least one band must be retrieved
bands.label: Bands to retrieve

crs.label: CRS
crs.tooltip: CRS to use for the exported image

crsTransform.label: CRS transform
crsTransform.tooltip: Optionally specity affine transform to use for the exported image

fileDimensionsMultiple.label: File dimensions multiple
fileDimensionsMultiple.tooLarge: Multiple * shard size must be less than or equal to 131072
fileDimensionsMultiple.tooltip: Multiples of the shard size to set the file dimentions to, the size to split each export into. E.g. for a shard size of 256 and a multiple of 10, the exported image will be downloaded it images with the maximum size of 2560x2560 pixels.

shardSize.label: Shard size
shardSize.tooltip: The size Earth Engine should break down the image into for processing. If you're running out of memory, try with a smaller value.

PRIVATE.label: Private
PRIVATE.tooltip: Only you can access this asset

task.GEE: Export {name} as a Google Earth Engine asset

tileSize.label: Tile size
tileSize.tooltip: The size to tile the images into. If you're running out of memory, try with a smaller value.

workspacePath.label: Workspace path
workspacePath.tooltip: Relative path in your workspace home directory where the image should be retrieved to.

saveRecipe.error: Sorry, but something went wrong when trying to save your recipe. If you close the window/tab, you will lose any changes you've made since last successful save. To make sure you have some record the data within this recipe, you might want to export it. Go to the top right recipe menu and select "Export recipe".
saveRecipe.title: Save recipe

timeSeries.description: Download time series of optical and radar data to SEPAL.

endDate.label: End date
endDate.tooltip: The last date of the time-series, exclusive.

startDate.label: Start date
startDate.tooltip: The first date of the time-series, inclusive.

classification.label: Classification
classification.tooltip: (Optional) Select a classification recipe and apply the classifier to every acquisition in the time-series.

form.required: A data source must be selected

export.pending: Submitting export task to Google Earth Engine
export.ready: Waiting for Google Earth Engine to start export

removeAll.label: Clear inactive tasks
removeAll.tooltip: Remove all completed, failed, or stopped tasks

unauthorized.warning: You are not logged in. Perhaps you have been inactive too long?

newPassword.invalid: Passwords must be at least 8 characters long
newPassword.label: New password

projectId.label: Google Cloud project
projectId.updated: Google Cloud project has been updated

connected.info: You have full access to SEPAL. If you disconnect your Google account from SEPAL, some features (like exporting to Earth Engine assets) will not be available.
connected.label: Connected
connected.title: Your SEPAL account is connected to your Google account

warning.message: Disconnecting your Google account would cause termination of any task started while connected. Tasks currently running: {taskCount}.
warning.title: Warning

disconnected.info: You have limited access to SEPAL. If you connect your Google account to SEPAL, all features (including exporting to Earth Engine assets) will be available.
disconnected.label: Disconnected
disconnected.success: SEPAL is now disconnected from your Google account.
disconnected.projectNeeded: SEPAL has been disconnected from your Google account, as Google Earth Engine users are now required to use a Cloud Project.|Please reconnect and select a Cloud Project.|If you need to create one, please login to the Earth Engine Code Editor, and click on "Register a new Cloud Project" from the user settings.
disconnected.title: Your SEPAL account is not connected to your Google account

missingScopes.title: Google Account reconnection required
missingScopes.message: The permissions you have previously authorized on your Google account don't match with the ones currently required by SEPAL. Please, reconnect your Google account.

unavailable.title: Earth Engine is not available
unavailable.message: Please make sure your Google Cloud Project has been registered.

unspecifiedError.title: Earth Engine is not available
unspecifiedError.message: We are currently unable to connect to Google Earth Engine.

quotaUpdate.title: Request additional resources
quotaUpdate.info1: Please propose suitable values for monthly spending and storage space, along with a justification for the requested change.
quotaUpdate.info2: SEPAL administrators will review your request.

update.success: Quota update request has been submitted.

quotaUpdate.info: Your SEPAL budget is not sufficient for this functionality. Please request additional resources using the button highlighted below.

email.label: Email
email.unique: There is another user with this email

emailNotifications.disabled.label: Disabled
emailNotifications.enabled.label: Enabled

manualMapRendering.disabled.label: Disabled
manualMapRendering.enabled.label: Enabled

instanceSpending.atLeast1: Instance spending must be at least 1

storageSpending.atLeast1: Storage spending must be at least 1

storageQuota.atLeast1: Storage space must be at least 1

monthlyLimits.label: Limits
monthlyLimits.tooltip: Maximum monthly spending (US$/month) for instances and storage, and maximum disk space (GB) allocated for storage.

username.format: Username must start with a letter and can only contain letters and digits
username.label: Username
username.unique: There is another user with this username

resetPassword.label: Reset
resetPassword.tooltip: Send a password reset email to the user.
resetPassword.message: The user will receive an email for setting a new password. Until that, the current password will still be valid.

lock.label: Lock
lock.message: The user will be locked and not be able to access SEPAL from now on.|Active sessions will be terminated, but all user data will be retained.

unlock.label: Unlock
unlock.message: The user will be unlocked.|A password reset email will be sent to the user for reactivating the SEPAL account.

confirmation.message: User role will be changed to "{role}"

keepAlive.info: Keep instance alive for at least {keepAliveUntil}.
keepAlive.label: Keep alive

suspend.label: Suspend
suspend.tooltip: Suspend session. Suspended sessions can be resumed.

updateState.success: User message state has been updated

users.count: {count} {count, plural, one {user} other {users}}, {lastMonthUserCount} updated in the last month

exists.notReplaceable: This asset already exists, but isn't an image or image collection, so you cannot overwrite it
exists.replaceable: This asset already exists, you have to confirm if you want to overwrite it or not

replace.label: Replace
replace.tooltip: Replace previous asset with this one.

resume.label: Resume
resume.tooltip: Keep existing images in the collection and only export missing ones.

codeEditor.help1: Enter an arithmetic expression, using input imagery and earlier calculation steps as input.
codeEditor.help2: A subset of the EE expressions are supported. Notably, you cannot assign variables to name bands, use indexes to refer to band, or use the `b()` syntax.

eeLint.undefinedVariable:
"{variableName}" is not defined. 

Variables must be the name of images, name of calculations declared before this function, math functions, or math constants.
eeLint.invalidBandCount: Images must contain the same number of bands or only 1 band. Got 2 and 3. "{imageName}" contains {bandCount} bands while another image contains {expectedBandCount}.

multiple.dropOrClick: Drop file(s) here, or click to select file(s)
multiple.reject: Cannot drop file(s). Wrong file type?

single.dropOrClick: Drop file here, or click to select file
single.reject: Cannot drop file. Wrong file type, or more than one file?

bit.label: bit
bit.tooltip: Apply a bitmask to the band. This is typically used for QA bands

logicalOr.tooltip: One of the constraints must be true

inclusive.label: incl
inclusive.tooltip: Determine if value is inclusive or not

notification.dismissOrWait: Click to dismiss or wait {timeout} {timeout, plural, one {second} other {seconds}}

all.tooltip: Show all recipes or only recipes in current project

chromeOnHighResDisplayWarning: The browser you are using can have issues when showing multiple layers at the same time on very high resolution displays, like yours. If your screen flickers or freezes, please reduce the number of layers or use a different browser, like Firefox or Safari, until the issue has been resolved.
